remarks.format: ## Remarks `UInt32`值类型表示值介于 0 到 4294967295 之间的无符号的整数。The `UInt32` value type represents unsigned integers with values ranging from 0 to 4,294,967,295. > [!IMPORTANT] > 类型不是符合 CLS。The type is not CLS-compliant. 符合 cls 的替代类型是。The CLS-compliant alternative type is . 可以改用替换值，其范围从 0 到。 can be used instead to replace a value that ranges from zero to . 有关 CLS 遵从性的详细信息，请参阅[语言独立性和独立于语言的组件](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md)。For more information about CLS compliance, see [Language Independence and Language-Independent Components](~/docs/standard/language-independence-and-language-independent-components.md). `UInt32` 提供用于比较此类型的实例，请将转换到实例的值的方法及其表示形式，并将转换到此类型的实例的数字表示形式。`UInt32` provides methods to compare instances of this type, convert the value of an instance to its representation, and convert the representation of a number to an instance of this type. 了解如何设置规范代码控件的格式表示形式的值类型，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For information about how format specification codes control the representation of value types, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md).

threadsafe.span: 作为与任何其他类型，读取和写入到共享的变量，其中包含此类型的实例必须受使用锁来确保的线程安全性。

span.span: As with any other type, reading and writing to a shared variable that contains an instance of this type must be protected by a lock to guarantee thread safety.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法实现接口，并且执行效果略好于方法因为它不具有要转换`value`对对象的参数。This method implements the interface and performs slightly better than the method because it does not have to convert the `value` parameter to an object. 具体取决于您的编程语言，它可能会对代码其中的参数类型具有较少的位的方法 （为较窄） 比实例类型。Depending on your programming language, it might be possible to code a method where the parameter type has fewer bits (is narrower) than the instance type. 这可能是因为某些编程语言中执行的隐式的扩大转换，它表示具有任意数量的位的实例作为类型参数。This is possible because some programming languages perform an implicit widening conversion that represents the parameter as a type with as many bits as the instance. 例如，假设实例类型是和参数类型是。For example, suppose the instance type is and the parameter type is . Microsoft C# 编译器生成的指令来表示形式的参数值对象，然后生成比较的值的方法实例和参数表示形式。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as an object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the parameter representation. 请查阅你的编程语言的文档，以确定其编译器是否对数值类型执行隐式的扩大转换。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine whether its compiler performs implicit widening conversions on numeric types. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示泛型和非泛型版本的多个值和引用类型的方法。The following code example demonstrates generic and nongeneric versions of the method for several value and reference types. span.para: 编译器重载决策可能应对明显的差异的两个行为方法重载。如果之间的隐式转换自变量和一个定义和自变量并不类型化为，编译器执行隐式转换和调用方法。否则，它们调用方法，始终返回如果其参数不是值。下面的示例阐释了两个方法重载之间的行为差异。情况下和值，第一个比较返回因为编译器自动执行一个的扩大转换，调用方法，而第二个比较返回由于编译器调用方法。 [！ code-csharp[System.UInt32.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint32.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#1)][！ code-vb[System.UInt32.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint32.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#1)]

Compiler overload resolution may account for an apparent difference in the behavior of the two method overloads. If an implicit conversion between the argument and a is defined and the argument is not typed as an , compilers perform an implicit conversion and call the method. Otherwise, they call the method, which always returns if its argument is not a value. The following example illustrates the difference in behavior between the two method overloads. In the case of and values, the first comparison returns because the compiler automatically performs a widening conversion and calls the method, whereas the second comparison returns because the compiler calls the method. [!code-csharp[System.UInt32.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint32.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.UInt32.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.uint32.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#1)]

[*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 有效的符号字符由和当前区域性的属性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture. 但是，可以仅使用零; 使用负号符号否则，该方法将引发。However, the negative sign symbol can be used only with zero; otherwise, the method throws an .| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9. 忽略任何前导零。Any leading zeros are ignored.| > [!NOTE] > 指定的字符串`s`参数解释使用样式。The string specified by the `s` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 不能包含任何组分隔符或小数分隔符，并且它不能具有小数部分。It cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a decimal portion. `s`通过使用中的格式设置信息分析参数初始化针对当前系统区域性的对象。The `s` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current system culture. 有关详细信息，请参阅。For more information, see . 若要通过使用特定区域性的格式设置信息中分析字符串，使用方法。To parse a string by using the formatting information of a specific culture, use the method. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法，以便分析的字符串值的数组。The following example uses the method to parse an array of string values. remarks.format:
## Remarks `style`参数定义中允许的样式元素 （如空格、 正整数或负号符号、 组分隔符符号或小数点符号）`s`分析操作成功的参数。The `style` parameter defines the style elements (such as white space, the positive or negative sign symbol, the group separator symbol, or the decimal point symbol) that are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. `style` 必须是中的位标志的组合枚举。`style` must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. `style`参数将使得此方法重载有用`s`时数字系统 （十进制或十六进制） 由包含的字符串表示形式的十六进制值，`s`仅在运行时，已知时，或者当你想要禁止的空白区域或正负符号`s`。The `style` parameter makes this method overload useful when `s` contains the string representation of a hexadecimal value, when the number system (decimal or hexadecimal) represented by `s` is known only at run time, or when you want to disallow white space or a sign symbol in `s`. 根据值`style`、`s`参数可能包括以下元素：Depending on the value of `style`, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*][*ws*][*$*][*sign*][*digits*,]*digits*[.*fractional_digits*][E[*sign*]*exponential_digits*][*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 如果`style`包括、`s`参数可能包含下列元素：If `style` includes , the `s` parameter may contain the following elements: [*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*][*ws*]*hexdigits*[*ws*] 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space. 空格可以出现在开始`s`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现在末尾`s`如果`style`包括标志。White space can appear at the start of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定于区域性的货币符号。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字符串中的位置由和当前区域性的属性。Its position in the string is defined by the and properties of the current culture. 当前区域性的货币符号可以出现在`s`如果`style`包括标志。The current culture's currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 符号可以出现在开始`s`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现在末尾`s`如果`style`包括标志。The sign can appear at the start of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 可以在使用括号`s`以指示负值，如果`style`包括标志。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag. 但是，可以仅使用零; 使用负号符号否则，该方法将引发。However, the negative sign symbol can be used only with zero; otherwise, the method throws an .| |*digits**digits*

*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*

*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|一系列从 0 到 9 的数字。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. 有关*fractional_digits*，但只数字 0 有效。For *fractional_digits*, only the digit 0 is valid.| |*，**,*|区域性特定的组分隔符符号。A culture-specific group separator symbol. 当前区域性的组分隔符可以出现在`s`如果`style`包括标志。The current culture's group separator can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 当前区域性的小数点符号可以出现在`s`如果`style`包括标志。The current culture's decimal point symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag. 仅数字 0 可以显示为分析操作才能成功; 一个小数数字如果*fractional_digits*包括任何其他数字引发。Only the digit 0 can appear as a fractional digit for the parse operation to succeed; if *fractional_digits* includes any other digit, a is thrown.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字符，指示该值表示指数 （科学型） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `s`参数可以表示指数记数法的数字，如果`style`包括标志。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|一系列从 0 到 f 或从 0 到 F.的十六进制数字A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 remarks.format: ## Remarks `s`参数包含一个数字的窗体：The `s` parameter contains a number of the form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 方括号 （[和]） 中是可选的项。Items in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后或负号如果`s`表示零的值。An optional sign, or a negative sign if `s` represents the value zero.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 使用解释 s 参数样式。The s parameter is interpreted using the style. 无符号的整数值的十进制数字，除了允许仅前导空格和尾随空格以及前导符号。In addition to the unsigned integer value's decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces along with a leading sign is allowed. (如果存在，负号，则`s`必须表示的值为零或该方法将引发。)若要显式定义的样式元素以及可出现在区域性特定格式设置信息`s`，使用方法。(If the negative sign is present, `s` must represent a value of zero, or the method throws an .) To explicitly define the style elements together with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `s`, use the method. `provider`参数是实现其方法返回对象，提供区域性特定信息的格式`s`。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of `s`. 有三种方法使用`provider`参数来提供到分析操作的自定义格式设置信息：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply custom formatting information to the parse operation: - 你可以将传递的实际提供格式设置信息的对象。You can pass the actual object that provides formatting information. (其实现仅返回它自身。)(Its implementation of simply returns itself.) - 你可以将传递指定的格式设置将使用的区域性的对象。You can pass a object that specifies the culture whose formatting is to be used. 其属性提供格式设置信息。Its property provides formatting information. - 你可以将自定义传递实现。You can pass a custom implementation. 其方法必须实例化并返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method must instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、使用当前区域性的。If `provider` is `null`, the for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例是按钮单击事件处理程序的 Web 窗体。The following example is the button click event handler of a Web form. 它使用返回的数组属性来确定用户的区域设置。It uses the array returned by the property to determine the user's locale. 它然后实例化对应于该区域设置的对象。It then instantiates a object that corresponds to that locale. 对象所属的对象随后会传递给方法将用户输入转换为值。The object that belongs to that object is then passed to the method to convert the user's input to a value. (该方法将引发如果`s`包括一个负号和表示的非零数字。)符号可以出现的开始处`s`如果`style`包括标志，它可以出现的末尾`s`如果`style`包括标志。(The method throws an if `s` includes a negative sign and represents a non-zero number.) The sign can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 可以在使用括号`s`以指示负值，如果`style`包括标志。Parentheses can be used in `s` to indicate a negative value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*|一系列从 0 到 9 的数字。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9.| |*.**.*|特定于区域性的小数点符号。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. 当前区域性的小数点符号可以出现在`s`如果`style`包括标志。The current culture's decimal point symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*|一个或多个出现的数字 0-9 如果`style`包括标志或如果它不为 0 的数字的一个或多个匹配项。One or more occurrences of the digit 0-9 if `style` includes the flag, or one or more occurrences of the digit 0 if it does not. 小数位数可以出现在`s`才`style`包括标志。Fractional digits can appear in `s` only if `style` includes the flag.| |EE|"E"或者"E"字符，指示该值表示指数 （科学型） 表示法。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates that the value is represented in exponential (scientific) notation. `s`参数可以表示指数记数法的数字，如果`style`包括标志。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*exponential_digits**exponential_digits*|一系列从 0 到 9 的数字。A sequence of digits from 0 through 9. `s`参数可以表示指数记数法的数字，如果`style`包括标志。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|一系列从 0 到 f 或从 0 到 F.的十六进制数字A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 through F.| 仅为十进制数字的字符串 (它对应于样式) 总是可以分析成功。A string with decimal digits only (which corresponds to the style) always parses successfully. 其余的大多数成员控件可能会存在，但不是要求必须存在，此输入字符串中的元素。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be present, but are not required to be present, in this input string. permitted in `s` in addition to digits| |------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------| ||仅为十进制数字。Decimal digits only.| ||小数点 (*。*) 和*fractional_digits*元素。The decimal point (*.*) and *fractional_digits* elements. 但是，如果样式不包括标志， *fractional_digits*必须包含仅一个或多个数字 0; 否则为引发。However, if style does not include the flag, *fractional_digits* must consist of only one or more 0 digits; otherwise, an is thrown.| ||"E"或"E"字符，它指示指数记数法，连同*exponential_digits*。The "e" or "E" character, which indicates exponential notation, along with *digits*.| ||之前和之后的括号*数字*以指示负值。Parentheses before and after *digits* to indicate a negative value.| ||组分隔符 (*，*) 元素。The group separator (*,*) element.| ||货币 (*$*) 元素。The currency (*$*) element.| 如果使用标志，`s`必须是十六进制值。If the flag is used, `s` must be a hexadecimal value. 仅其他标志，可以与它组合为和。The only other flags that can be combined with it are and . (枚举包含复合数字样式， ，其中包含两个空白标志。)(The enumeration includes a composite number style, , that includes both white-space flags.) > [!NOTE] > 如果`s`参数的值的字符串表示形式的十六进制数，则无法前面添加的任何修饰符 (如`0x`或`&h`) 用于将其识别为十六进制数。If the `s` parameter is the string representation of a hexadecimal number, it cannot be preceded by any decoration (such as `0x` or `&h`) that differentiates it as a hexadecimal number. 这将导致分析操作引发异常。This causes the parse operation to throw an exception. `provider`参数是实现其方法返回对象，提供区域性特定信息的格式`s`。The `provider` parameter is an implementation whose method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of `s`. 有三种方法使用`provider`参数来提供到分析操作的自定义格式设置信息：There are three ways to use the `provider` parameter to supply custom formatting information to the parse operation: - 你可以将传递的实际提供格式设置信息的对象。You can pass the actual object that provides formatting information. (其实现仅返回它自身。)(Its implementation of simply returns itself.) - 你可以将传递指定的格式设置将使用的区域性的对象。You can pass a object that specifies the culture whose formatting is to be used. 其属性提供格式设置信息。Its property provides formatting information. - 你可以将自定义传递实现。You can pass a custom implementation. 其方法必须实例化并返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method must instantiate and return the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`、对象使用当前区域性的。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法将各种字符串表示形式之间的数字转换为 32 位无符号的整数值。The following example uses the method to convert various string representations of numbers to 32-bit unsigned integer values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式值在默认的 （"G"或常规） 中使用的格式指定区域性的对象。The method formats a value in the default ("G", or general) format by using the object of a specified culture. 如果你想要指定不同的格式或当前区域性，使用的其他重载方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or the current culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| `provider`参数是实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation. 其方法返回提供区域性特定格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific formatting information. 但是，没有一个属性的使用通用数值格式说明符 ("G") 格式设置时使用。However, none of the properties of the are used when formatting with the general numeric format specifier ("G"). ## Examples 下面的示例通过使用多个格式提供程序，其中包括一个用于固定区域性设置一个 16 位有符号的整数值。The following example formats a 16-bit signed integer value by using several format providers, including one for the invariant culture. 该示例的输出阐释带格式的字符串返回的方法无论是相同的格式提供程序。The output from the example illustrates that the formatted string returned by the method is the same regardless of the format provider. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式中通过使用指定的格式值对象，表示当前区域性的约定。The method formats a value in a specified format by using a object that represents the conventions of the current culture. 如果你想要使用默认值 （"G"或常规） 格式或指定不同的区域性，请使用其他重载的方法，如下所示：If you want to use the default ("G", or general) format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| `format`参数可以是任何有效[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，或的任意组合[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), or any combination of [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`等同于或`null`，当前的返回值对象使用常规格式说明符 ("G") 进行格式化。If `format` is equal to or is `null`, the return value of the current object is formatted with the general format specifier ("G"). 如果`format`是任何其他值，该方法将引发。If `format` is any other value, the method throws a . .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关.NET Framework 中的格式设置支持的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about support for formatting in the .NET Framework, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 返回字符串的格式由为当前区域性的对象。The format of the returned string is determined by the object for the current culture. 具体取决于`format`参数，此对象控制如组分隔符符号和输出字符串中的小数点符号。Depending on the `format` parameter, this object controls symbols such as the group separator and the decimal point symbol in the output string. 若要提供区域性而非当前区域性的格式设置信息，请调用重载。To provide formatting information for cultures other than the current culture, call the overload. ## Examples 下面的示例显示一个 32 位无符号的整数值，通过使用每个标准格式字符串和某些自定义格式字符串。The following example displays a 32-bit unsigned integer value by using each standard format string and some custom format strings. 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 你可以将传递表示的区域性的提供格式设置信息的对象。You can pass a object that represents the culture that supplies formatting information. 其方法返回提供该区域性的数字格式设置信息的对象。Its method returns the object that provides numeric formatting information for that culture. - 你可以将传递的实际提供数字格式设置信息的对象。You can pass the actual object that provides numeric formatting information. (其实现仅返回它自身。)(Its implementation of just returns itself.) - 你可以传递的自定义对象，实现。You can pass a custom object that implements . 其方法实例化，并返回提供格式设置信息的对象。Its method instantiates and returns the object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`，返回字符串的格式设置将基于当前区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null`, the formatting of the returned string is based on the object of the current culture. ## Examples 下面的示例显示一个 32 位无符号的整数值，通过使用标准数字格式说明符和大量的特定对象。The following example displays a 32-bit unsigned integer value by using the standard numeric format specifiers and a number of specific objects. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像是方法，但它不会引发异常，如果转换失败。The method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 此方法无需使用异常处理来测试是否如果`s`无效，无法成功分析。This method eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a if `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `s`参数应为以下形式的十进制数字的字符串表示：The `s` parameter should be the string representation of a decimal number in the following form: [*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*][*ws*][*sign*]*digits*[*ws*] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。Optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign. 有效的符号字符由和当前区域性的属性。Valid sign characters are determined by the and properties of the current culture.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的十进制数字的序列。A sequence of decimal digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `s`参数解释使用样式。The `s` parameter is interpreted by using the style. 十进制数字，除了允许仅前导空格和尾随空格带有前导符号。In addition to the decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces with a leading sign are allowed. 若要显式定义可出现在的区域性特定格式设置信息的样式元素`s`，调用方法。To explicitly define the style elements with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `s`, call the method. > [!NOTE] > 指定的字符串`s`参数不能包含任何组分隔符或小数分隔符，并且它不能具有小数部分。The string specified by the `s` parameter cannot contain any group separators or decimal separator, and it cannot have a fractional portion. `s`通过使用中的格式设置信息分析参数针对当前系统区域性的对象。The `s` parameter is parsed by using the formatting information in a object for the current system culture. 有关详细信息，请参阅。For more information, see . 此重载将解释中的所有位`s`为十进制数字的参数。This overload interprets all digits in the `s` parameter as decimal digits. 若要分析的字符串表示形式的十六进制数，请调用重载。To parse the string representation of a hexadecimal number, call the overload instead. ## Examples 下面的示例调用对于字符串数组中每个元素执行一次的方法。The following example calls the method once for each element in a string array.
